de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.prattParser
Class ParseletProvider

java.lang.Object
  de.halirutan.mathematica.parsing.prattParser.ParseletProvider

public class ParseletProvider
extends java.lang.Object

This works like a singleton but instead of providing an instance of the class, you can access the Mathematica operator properties (precedences, parselets, Psi-tree elements) which is initialized only once. This class is basically the center of the parser because it provides the MathematicaParser with all the small parselets which finally do the work of parsing specific expressions.

Therefore, I first need to select the appropriate parselet for a lexer token. This parselet parses then the specific expression and marks the node in the AST.

getInfixPsiElement

public static com.intellij.psi.tree.IElementType getInfixPsiElement(InfixParselet parselet)
Provides the parselet with the element type of the node for the AST. When an expression was parsed with a specific InfixParselet the node in the AST is then the IElementType which is returned by this method. E.g. When a PLUS token arises in the lexer token stream first the infix-parselet of the PLUS token is extracted with getInfixParselet(IElementType) which parses the left and right operand. Afterwards it marks the whole expression a+b in the AST tree as being a node of type returned by this method.

Parameters:
parselet - The parselet for which the node type is wanted
Returns:
The node type.

getPrefixPsiElement
